message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of navigating mobile robots in indoor environments, which is a core topic in robotics (cs.RO). The approach proposed in the paper involves using probabilistic graphical models to make predictions, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of computer vision techniques to capture patterns in traversability changes (cs.CV). The approach involves planning paths that trade off risk and information gain, which is a problem that can be addressed using machine learning techniques such as reinforcement learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of long-term navigation, which involves maintaining a consistent estimate of the environment over time, which is a topic in control systems (cs.SY).
